script: Hi, I brought my laptop in yesterday for a screen repair. When I picked it up this morning, it seemed totally fine. Unfortunately, the screen keeps flickering every time I open a new tab. Can one of your technicians take another look at it today?

options: To introduce a negative, unexpected outcome after a seemingly positive event.
To angrily accuse the repair shop of intentionally breaking the laptop.
To apologize for dropping the laptop and breaking the screen again.
To boast that they know how to fix the laptop themselves.

explanation: The speaker uses 'Unfortunately' to signal bad news or an undesirable shift in the situation they are describing.
